entries.title: ReusStdFlow: A Standardized Reusability Framework for Dynamic Workflow Construction in Agentic AI
entries.authors: Gaoyang Zhang, Shanghong Zou, Yafang Wang, He Zhang, Ruohua Xu, Feng Zhao
entries.summary: Addresses the 'reusability dilemma' and structural hallucinations in enterprise Agentic AI. Proposes a novel 'Extraction-Storage-Construction' paradigm that deconstructs heterogeneous platform-specific Domain Specific Languages (DSLs) into reusable components.

entries.title: Evolutionary System Prompt Learning can Facilitate Reinforcement Learning for LLMs
entries.authors: Lunjun Zhang, Ryan Chen, Bradly C. Stadie
entries.summary: Building agentic systems that can autonomously self-improve from experience. Explores evolutionary approaches to system prompt optimization that facilitate downstream reinforcement learning tasks.

entries.title: Configuring Agentic AI Coding Tools: An Exploratory Study
entries.authors: Matthias Galster, Seyedmoein Mohsenimofidi, Jai Lal Lulla, Muhammad Auwal Abubakar, Christoph Treude, Sebastian Baltes
entries.summary: An exploratory study on how developers configure agentic AI coding tools. Examines configuration patterns, challenges, and best practices for tools like Claude Code, Cursor, and similar AI coding assistants.

entries.title: Model Context Protocol (MCP) Tool Descriptions Are Smelly!
entries.authors: Mohammed Mehedi Hasan, Hao Li, Gopi Krishnan Rajbahadur, Bram Adams, Ahmed E. Hassan
entries.summary: MCP standardizes how Foundation Model-based agents interact with external systems. This paper shows that tool descriptions are often inadequate and proposes improvements to help FMs select optimal tools for tasks.

entries.title: Sovereign Agents: Towards Infrastructural Sovereignty and Diffused Accountability in Decentralized AI
entries.summary: Explores decentralized AI infrastructure where agents have sovereign control. Examines accountability frameworks for distributed AI systems and the challenges of maintaining control while enabling autonomy.

entries.title: Kami of the Commons: Towards Designing Agentic AI to Steward the Commons
entries.summary: Speculative design work exploring AI stewards for common resources. Draws from Shinto animism where natural elements have protective spirits - proposes AI agents as digital 'kami' that steward shared digital and physical commons.

entries.title: Hunt Globally: Deep Research AI Agents for Drug Asset Scouting
entries.authors: Alisa Vinogradova, Vlad Vinogradov, Luba Greenwood, Ilya Yasny, et al.
entries.summary: Deep Research AI agents for pharmaceutical asset scouting and investment. Shows how AI can accelerate drug discovery by autonomously searching, evaluating and recommending investment opportunities.

entries.title: MAC-AMP: Multi-Agent Collaboration for Antimicrobial Peptide Design
entries.authors: Gen Zhou, Sugitha Janarthanan, Lianghong Chen, Pingzhao Hu
entries.summary: Closed-loop multi-agent collaboration system for designing antimicrobial peptides. Balances multiple objectives (activity, toxicity, novelty) using coordinated agent teams.

entries.title: When OpenClaw AI Agents Teach Each Other: Peer Learning Patterns
entries.authors: Eason Chen, Ce Guan, Ahmed Elshafiey, Zhonghao Zhao, Joshua Zekeri, Afeez Edeifo Shaibu, Emmanuel Osadebe Prince
entries.summary: Studies peer learning among OpenClaw AI agents in the Moltbook community. Documents how AI agents can teach and learn from each other - a novel educational phenomenon.

entries.title: A Trajectory-Based Safety Audit of Clawdbot (OpenClaw)
entries.authors: Tianyu Chen, Dongrui Liu, Xia Hu, Jingyi Yu, Wenjie Wang
entries.summary: Safety audit of Clawdbot (the predecessor to OpenClaw). Provides trajectory-based analysis of tool-use safety, security considerations, and risk management for self-hosted AI agents.

entries.title: LongCLI-Bench: Benchmark for Long-horizon Agentic Programming in CLI
entries.summary: New benchmark for evaluating AI agents in long-horizon command-line interface tasks. Tests agents on complex, multi-step terminal operations.

entries.title: MATEO: Multimodal Benchmark for Temporal Reasoning in LVLMs
entries.authors: Gabriel Roccabruna, Olha Khomyn, Giuseppe Riccardi
entries.summary: Evaluates multimodal LLMs on temporal reasoning and planning. Tests agents' ability to understand time-based dependencies and execute ordered steps.

entries.title: Introspective Experience: Conversational Environments for Better Learning
entries.authors: Claudiu Cristian Musat, Jackson Tolins, Diego Antognini, Jingling Li, Martin Klissarov, Tom Duerig
entries.summary: Argues that robust reasoning emerges from linguistic self-reflection, internalized from high-quality social interaction. Draws on Vygotskian developmental psychology to propose introspective training for AI agents.
